column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column8: Stakeholder Engagement Model for Relationship with the External Auditor
column13: ANZ's Stakeholder Engagement Model for Relationship with the External Auditor, which incorporates requirements of the Corporations Act 2001 and industry best practices, prevents the external auditor from providing services that are perceived to conflict with the role of the external auditor or breach independence requirements. It includes consulting advice, sub-contracting operational activities normally undertaken by management, and engagements where the external auditor may ultimately be required to express an opinion on its work.
column20: Stakeholder Engagement Model for Relationship with the External Auditor, independence requirement, external auditor

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column13: ANZ's Whistleblower Program is one of many channels encouraging and empowering its people to speak up and raise misconduct concerns freely and without fear of reprisal. The Policy and program provide strong protections for individuals who disclose misconduct and play a pivotal role in maintaining the organisation's integrity. Information received through the Whistleblower channel helps ANZ identify misconduct that may not otherwise be detected and act on issues that do not support its purpose, values and expected behaviours.
column20: Whistleblower Program, misconduct, fear of reprisal

column13: ANZ's sanctions compliance program guides its Group-wide approach to meeting its sanctions obligations. Sanctions risks are assessed to identify, manage and mitigate the potential for breaches. Customer relationships and activities with higher sanctions risk are subject to enhanced due diligence measures, monitoring and approval. ANZ is enhancing its monitoring of transactions and strengthening customer due diligence processes to continue to support transactions within its risk appetite and in a manner compliant with applicable regulatory obligations.
column20: Sanctions compliance program, sanctions obligation, due diligence

column13: The Trading in ANZ Securities Policy prohibits trading in ANZ securities by all employees, Directors and contractors who possess information that is not generally available and that could be reasonably expected to have a material or significant effect on the price or value of an ANZ security. The Policy specifically prohibits ANZ Directors and certain 'restricted persons' (which includes certain senior executives) and their associates from trading in ANZ securities during 'blackout periods' as defined in the Policy.
column20: Trading in ANZ Securities Policy, ANZ security, restricted person

column13: ANZ ran an international awareness campaign to mark World Whistleblower Day in June. It included a conversation guide designed to support people leaders with team discussions on the importance of speaking up and promotion of ANZ's Whistleblower Program.
column20: World Whistleblower Day, awareness campaign, people leader

column13: ANZ's Living the Code course reinforces the importance of its values and seeks a declaration of compliance with the Code. By completing the course, participants confirm they understand the Code's principles and have complied with them over the last 12 months.
column20: Living the Code course, value, the Code

column7: In Australia, a collective bargaining agreement covers approximately 91.1% of employees.

column13: This year, ANZ increased its external engagement and review of the external environment. ANZ's assessment approach considered the impact of ESG issues on the economy, environment, and people, including impacts on human rights, as well as the impact ESG issues may have on its operating performance. ANZ used double materiality Ã¢ÂÂ seeking views from stakeholders on both ANZ's impact Ã¢ÂÂ both positive and negative Ã¢ÂÂ on society and the environment (externally focused) and ANZ's ability to create value (internally focused).
column20: Assessment approach, external engagement, ESG issue

column7: ANZ's material topics include customer experience, environmental sustainability, and housing.

column13: ANZ's Healthy Home Loan package offers interest rate discounts and fee savings for eligible customers who are buying, building, renovating, or already owning a home with a 6 Homestar rating or higher.
column20: Healthy Home Loan, interest rate discount, Homestar rating

column13: Over 11,000 Kiwis took advantage of ANZ's new Home Loan Check-In this year. An average of 55% of these customers decided to take action following the check-in, including making changes to their loans. The check-in is designed to support customers through the current economic environment to help ensure their home loan meets their needs.
column20: Home Loan Check-In, economic environment, home loan

column13: ANZ's partnership with the New Zealand Green Building Council includes support for HomeFit Ã¢ÂÂ a free online tool to check the health, comfort, energy efficiency and safety of new homes or advise on how New Zealanders can improve the health of their current home.
column20: HomeFit, Green Building Council, online tool

column13: ANZ's partnership with CoreLogic (a leading provider of property data and analytics) delivers housing affordability research and in-depth market analysis for the Australian housing market. In 2023, CoreLogic research showed that fluctuations in interest rates, inflation, and migration created a mismatch of housing supply and demand, deteriorating rental affordability with a particular pain point for low-income households and increasing pressure on social housing providers and homelessness service providers.
column20: CoreLogic, market analysis, Australian housing market

column13: In 2023, ANZ Singapore was recognised by the Singapore National Volunteer & Philanthropy Centre (NVPC) as a Champion of Good. ANZ was commended for its long-term dedication to giving back to the community despite the challenges posed by the pandemic. For example, ANZ employees in Singapore are helping their community thrive through volunteering with Willing Hearts, where they've cooked and packed over 10,000 meals for vulnerable families.
column20: Champion of Good, National Volunteer & Philanthropy Centre, pandemic

column13: ANZ launched a new low-interest ANZ Business Regrowth Loan in New Zealand, aimed at creating a more enduring solution for those needing finance following extreme weather events.
column20: Business Regrowth Loan, finance, extreme weather event

column13: Handing card details to a new merchant can concern some customers, especially for high-value transactions. To help with this, ANZ Plus has introduced Visa Card Authentication Service, which allows customers to approve transactions identified as higher risk in the ANZ Plus app, improving security.
column20: Visa Card Authentication Service, card detail, ANZ Plus App

column13: ANZ's 'Banking the Unbanked' program is a rural banking business model operating in Fiji in partnership with the United Nations Development Program. It delivers basic, affordable, reliable banking services to remote and disadvantaged communities.
column20: Banking the Unbanked, Rural Banking, Fiji

column13: This year, ANZ piloted a daily "transaction score" in Australia, which can be used for hardship handling, developed with global analytics software leader FICO. The transaction score is calculated using banking data fed into machine learning, which provides a score on a customer account where there may be early signs of financial stress.
column20: Transaction score, hardship handling, FICO

column13: The Way Forward Debt Solutions is a registered charity that provides free debt management services to assist people needing extra care to establish affordable arrangements with their creditors and manage debt repayments. This year, ANZ referred 61 customer accounts with current funds under management of around $5.4 million.
column20: Way Forward Debt Solutions, debt management, debt repayment

column13: CareRing is a program by Uniting that connects customers to a coordinated range of support services, including housing support, social workers, drug and alcohol services, home energy assessments and employment services. ANZ referred nearly 500 customers to CareRing this year. Clients of the CareRing program can also be referred to ANZ's MoneyMinded program to develop their basic budgeting skills.
column20: CareRing, Uniting, housing support

column13: ANZ aims to assess and manage the impacts of its lending decisions by applying the Social and Environmental Risk Policy and accompanying Requirements, including for 'sensitive sectors'. The Policy outlines the social and environmental factors to be considered by ANZ's bankers when considering large business transactions. It incorporates ANZ's approach to human rights, including 'zero tolerance' for land acquisition and involuntary resettlement that are considered improper, as well as labour rights issues such as modern slavery.
column20: Social and Environmental Risk Policy, sensitive sector, human rights

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column7: ANZ generated $7,098 million in profit in 2023.

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: ANZ's Climate Change Commitment provides the framework to achieve its strategy of transitioning its lending in line with the goals of the Paris Agreement. ANZ joined the Net-Zero Banking Alliance (NZBA) in 2021, reflecting that commitment and setting pathways to support customers' emissions reductions.
column20: Climate Change Commitment, Paris Agreement, emissions reduction

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: ANZ's Business Green Loan is available for eligible business customers to finance (or refinance) renewable energy initiatives, green buildings, native planting or sustainable land and water use to impact the environment positively. The loan was launched in late August 2022, where eligible businesses can borrow up to NZ$3 million at a discounted rate.
column20: Business Green Loan, business customer, renewable energy initiative

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: ANZ Group Treasury's capital and funding strategy includes SDG bond issuance, which supports its ambition to finance customers' green, social and sustainability initiatives. ANZ's SDG Bond Framework sets out a wide range of eligible loans that support specified use of proceeds in alignment with selected United Nations' SDGs.
column20: SDG Bond Framework, SDG bond issuance, eligible loan

column6: Defined benefit plan obligations and other retirement plans
column7: The main defined benefit superannuation schemes in which the Group participates operate under trust law and are managed and administered on behalf of the members following the terms of the relevant trust deed and rules and all relevant legislation.
ANZ received no financial assistance from the government.

column6: Ratios of standard entry level wage by gender compared to local minimum wage
column13: As a signatory to the Business Council of Australia's Supplier Payment Code, ANZ is committed to paying Australian small business suppliers within a maximum of 30 days of receiving a correct invoice or otherwise following the Code unless the contract stipulates a shorter term. However, ANZ aims to pay small businesses and all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander businesses, regardless of size, as promptly as possible upon invoice approval.
column20: Supplier Payment Code, small business supplier, invoice approval

column6: Proportion of senior management hired from the local community
column13: ANZ is a member of the Social Traders, an organisation helping to create jobs for disadvantaged Australians by linking business and government to social enterprises. This year, ANZ spent $7.1 million with social enterprises.
column20: Social Traders, social enterprise, disadvantaged Australian

column13: In New Zealand, ANZ is a member of Akina, a buyer group that provides access to a wide range of certified social enterprise suppliers. ANZ spent NZ$144,000 with social enterprises in 2023 and seeks to influence its suppliers to use social enterprises in their supply chain.
column20: Akina, social enterprise, supply chain
